name: Barbell Deadlifts
description: The deadlift involves many muscles, all of your limbs, and every load-bearing joint (ankles, knees, hips and shoulders) in your body. There are a lot of variables at play. So having hard-and-fast rules about deadlift form is nearly impossible.
tips: Keeping your core, arms, and lats engaged will help you avoid rounding your spine, which is dangerous. DO NOT ROUND YOUR SPINE.
During a conventional deadlift, if you are thinking about “pushing the floor away,” it will help you generate tension throughout your hips and knees.

instructions.instruction: Stand with your mid-foot under the bar and grip the bar with your hands, about a shoulder width apart.
Bend your knees, then lift the bar by straightening your back. It is important to keep your back straight.

instruction: Stand to your full height and hold.
Lower the bar to the floor by bending your knees and keeping your back straight.
